result.execSummary:
The defendant Rita D Arms was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Costs and Surcharges to be paid in 2 years or serve 9 days Jail, Consecutive, as penalty for non payment of costs and surcharge.

Jail (Straight Time).
Credit For Time Served 11 Days.
Consecutive to: Waukesha County Case #14CM2274.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Rita D Arms

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Rita D Arms in court, in custody, with attorney Joseph Smith.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count #1.  The Court finds the Defendant guilty.  The defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT #1:

JAIL:  3 MONTHS; (apply 11 days credit) Consecutive to 14CM2274

COURT COSTS:  $243.00 (to be paid in 2 years or serve 9 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of costs and surcharge);

DNA SURCHARGE: $200.00 to be paid in 2 years.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant to have no contact with Walgreens or Pick n Save in the city of Brookfield listed in the Criminal Complaint.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing
